info.title: Zencoder API Reference
info.description: Reference for the Brightcove Zencoder API, used to create and manage Zencoder encoding jobs.

post.description: Encoding jobs are created by sending an HTTP POST request to https://app.zencoder.com/api/v2/jobs. The post body must include two things: the URL of a video to process and your API key. It may also include output settings for the job, including an output destination, notification settings, and transcoding settings.

400.description: NOT_AVAILABLE: The resource you are requesting is temporarily unavailable

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Authentication failed; check to make sure your policy key is correct

404.description: RESOURCE_NOT_FOUND: The api couldn't find the resource you requested

500.description:
UNKNOWN: Issue in Brightcove system; try again later. 
TIMEOUT: Server likely too busy; try again later.

api_key.description: Zencoder api key (must be included here if not passed in a header, which is the recommended way)

input.description: A valid URL to a media file (HTTP/HTTPS, FTP/FTPS, SFTP, Azure, GCS, CF or S3), with or without authentication

region.description: The AWS region where Zencoder should process the job

test.description: Enable test mode ("Integration Mode") for a job

private.description: Enable privacy mode for a job

download_connections.description: Utilize multiple, simultaneous connections for download acceleration (in some circumstances)

pass_through.description: Optional information to store alongside this job

grouplng.description: A report grouping for this job

aspera_transfer_policy.description: How to allocate available bandwidth for Aspera file transfers

transfer_minimum_rate.description: A targeted rate in Kbps for data transfer minimums

transfer_maximum_rate.description: A targeted rate in Kbps for data transfer maximums

credentials.description: References saved credentials by a nickname

notifications.description: An array of notification strings (valid email addresses or URLs), or hashes of url and format

oneOf.description: A valid email address or URL to send the notification to
An object describing the destination and format for notifications regarding the job

url.description: A valid HTTP or HTTPS URL to notify, optionally including HTTP Auth credentials

format.description: A format and content type for notifications

headers.description: By default, HTTP notifications are sent with an HTTP Content-Type, along with a User-Agent; if your application requires additional headers, they can be specified here as `header_name/value` pairs

event.description: Live outputs have additional notification events corresponding to the progress of the file

outputs.description: An array of Array of output specifications for the encoding job

items.description: An object describing the destination and format for notifications regarding the job

type.description: The type of file to output

label.description: An optional label for this output - should be unique for the job

url.description: An S3, Cloud Files, GCS, FTP, FTPS, SFTP, Aspera, Azure, HTTP, or RTMP URL where Zencoder will put the transcoded file

secondary_url.description: An S3, Cloud Files, GCS, FTP, FTPS, SFTP, Aspera, Azure, HTTP, or RTMP URL where Zencoder will put the transcoded file

base_url.description: A base S3, Cloud Files, GCS, FTP, FTPS, SFTP, Azure, or Aspera directory URL where Zencoder put the transcoded file, without a filename

filename.description: The filename of a finished file

package_filename.description: The filename of a packaged output

package_format.description: Zip/packaging format to use for the output file(s)

device_profile.description: A device profile to use for mobile device compatibility
